title: Create an Account
name: Create_an_Account
description: All that is required is an email address and an agreement to the terms of service. You can also send a password, but if you don't one will be generated. New accounts will be created under the Test (Free) plan.

Request Body Fields.description: Email address of the account owner - must be unique
Indication that you agree to the terms of service
Password
Password confirmation

Response Fields.description: The api key used to authenticate other API requests
The password submitted or an auto-generated one

title: Get Account Details
name: Get_Account_Details
description: Account details may be retrieved by issuing an HTTP GET to https://app.zencoder.com/api/v2/account. Account states are Active, Stopped, Suspended, and Cancelled. Billing states are Active, Past Due, and Cancelled.

Response Fields.description: Minutes of encoded output used this month
Minutes of encoded output included in your plan (per month)
Whether the account is in integration (test) mode

title: Turn Off Integration Mode
name: Turn_Off_Integration_Mode
description: Integration mode can be turned off by issuing a PUT request to https://app.zencoder.com/api/v2/account/live. A successful response will be indicated by a HTTP status of 204 No Content

title: Turn On Integration Mode
name: Turn_On_Integration_Mode
description: Integration mode can be turned on by issuing a PUT request to https://app.zencoder.com/api/v2/account/integration. A successful response will be indicated by a HTTP status of 204 No Content

title: Get Input Details
name: Get_Input_Details
description: Get details of the input file for a job.

Request Body Fields.description: The ad configuration object
Human readable description of the configuration.
The expected response type based on your ad server
Specifies whether ad breaks should include single or muliple ads
Array of ad configuration transforms.
xpath for the transform.
xslt stylesheet for the transform.
Format for the ad tag - see Server-Side Ad Insertion Using the Brightcove Live API for the available ad configuration variables.
Human readable description of the ad application.
Your account id.
The amount of ad content to buffer, in seconds.

Response Fields.description: Audio bitrate of the input media file
Audio codec of the input media file
Audio sample rate of the input media file
ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the input file was created
ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the input file was finished
ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the input file was last modified
Video bitrate of the input media file
Video codec of the input media file
Frame width of the input media file
Total bitrate of the input media file

examples.title: Success response for get input details

title: Input Progress
name: Update_Input_Progress
description: Get the progress of processing for the input file. The current_event_progress number is the percent complete of the current event – so if the event is Downloading, and current_event_progress is 99.3421, then the file is almost finished downloading, but hasn't started Inspecting yet. The progress number is the overall percentage of completion for the input. The progress number is the percent complete of the current event – so if the event is Downloading, and progress is 99.3421, then the file is almost finished downloading, but hasn't started Inspecting yet. Valid states include: waiting, pending, assigning, processing, finished, failed, cancelled. Events include: downloading and inspecting. If you're getting a 404 to an input progress request, make sure that you're using the input ID, not the job or output ID, and make sure your API key is correct. A 404 means that we didn't find an input file with the specified ID for the account linked to the provided API key.

Response Fields.description: State for the input: pending, waiting, processing, finished, failed, or cancelled

title: Cancel a Job
name: Cancel_a_Job
description: If you wish to cancel a job that has not yet finished processing you may send a request (using any HTTP method) to https://app.zencoder.com/api/v2/jobs/1234/cancel. If cancellation succeeds you will receive a 204 No Content response. Only jobs that are in the “waiting” or “processing” state may be cancelled. If you attempt to cancel a job in any other state you will receive a 409 Conflict response.

URL Parameters.description: The job id for the job you want to cancel.

title: Create a Job
name: Create_a_Job
description: Encoding jobs are created by sending an HTTP POST request to https://app.zencoder.com/api/v2/jobs. The post body must include two things: the URL of a video to process and your API key. It may also include output settings for the job, including an output destination, notification settings, and transcoding settings.

Request Body Fields.description: API key for your Zencoder account (must be included here if not passed as a header, which is the recommended way) - get your API key from (https://app.zencoder.com/api)
A valid URL to a media file (HTTP/HTTPS, FTP/FTPS, SFTP, Azure, GCS, CF or S3), with or without authentication
Create a Live streaming job
The AWS region or Google Compute Engine instance (beta) where Zencoder should process the job
Enable test mode ("Integration Mode") for a job
Enable privacy mode for a job
Utilize multiple, simultaneous connections for download acceleration (in some circumstances)
Optional information to store alongside this job
Send a mocked job request
A report grouping for this job
How to allocate available bandwidth for Aspera file transfers
A targeted rate in Kbps for data transfer minimums
A targeted rate in Kbps for data transfer maximums
References saved credentials by a nickname
An array of notification strings (valid email addresses or URLs), or hashes of url and format
A valid HTTP or HTTPS URL to notify, optionally including HTTP Auth credentials
A format and content type for notifications
By default, HTTP notifications are sent with an HTTP Content-Type, along with a User-Agent; if your application requires additional headers, they can be specified here
Live outputs have additional notification events corresponding to the progress of the file
Array of output specifications

examples.title: Success Response Create a Job:

title: Finish a Live Job
name: Finish_a_Live_Job
description: Finishes the input on a Live streaming job. Has no effect on non-Live jobs. A Live job can also finish by stopping the source stream in the broadcast software. Calling finish will disregard the reconnect_time and event_length options and finish the stream immediately, while stopping the stream in the broadcast software will respect them. Note that jobs cannot be finished when archive output is transcoding.

URL Parameters.description: The job id for the job you want to cancel.

Response Fields.description: The job id for the stream that was stopped

examples.title: Success Response Finish a Live Job:

title: Get Job Details
name: Get_Job_Details
description: Get Job Details. Job details are available for two months after the job is submitted.

title: Job Progress
name: Job_Progress
description: Get the progress of a job. The return will contain one or more of the following keys: state, input, outputs, and progress.

URL Parameters.description: The job id for the job you want to cancel.

Response Fields.description: The overall progress state: pending, waiting, processing, finished, failed, or cancelled
Progress for getting and processing the input
State for the input: pending, waiting, processing, finished, failed, or cancelled
State for an output: pending, waiting, processing, finished, failed, or cancelled
The overall percentage complete for processing an output

title: List Jobs
name: List_Jobs
description: A list of jobs can be obtained by sending an HTTP GET request to https://app.zencoder.com/api/v2/jobs?api_key=93h630j1dsyshjef620qlkavnmzui3 (replace the api_key with your own). It will return an array of jobs similar to the example below. The list of thumbnails will be empty until the job is completed. By default, the results are paginated with 50 jobs per page and sorted by ID in descending order. You can pass two parameters to control the paging: page and per_page. per_page has a limit of 50. Note that historical jobs data is kept by Zencoder for 60 days - if you need to keep jobs data for longer periods, you need to retrieve it within 60 days and save it in your own data storage.

Response Fields.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the job was created

title: Resubmit a Job
name: Resubmit_a_Job
description: If a job has failed processing with a transient error that may be solved by attempting processing again (such as a network timeout, or if you fix permissions on your server that had caused a download permission error) you may request that it be attempted again. You may resubmit a job for processing by sending a PUT request to https://app.zencoder.com/api/v2/jobs/1234/resubmit?api_key=93h630j1dsyshjef620qlkavnmzui3. Only jobs that are not in the “finished” state may be resubmitted. If resubmission succeeds you will receive a 204 No Content response. If you attempt to resubmit a “finished” job you will receive a 409 Conflict response. Resubmit requests are limited to prevent runaway scripts from repeatedly resubmitting a failing job. If you attempt to resubmit a job more times than the limit amount, you will receive a 403 Forbidden response. The limit is currently 5 attempts, but may change without warning.

URL Parameters.description: The job id you want details for.

title: Output Progress
name: Update_Output_Progress
description: Get the progress of processing for an output file. The current_event_progress number is the percent complete of the current event – so if the event is Transcoding, and current_event_progress is 99.3421, then the file is almost finished transcoding, but hasn't started uploading yet. The progress number is the overall percentage of completion for the output. The progress number is the percent complete of the current event – so if the event is Transcoding, and progress is 99.3421, then the file is almost finished transcoding, but hasn't started Uploading yet. Valid states include: waiting, queued, assigning, processing, finished, failed, cancelled, no input, and skipped. Events include: downloading, transcoding and uploading. If you're getting a 404 to a Job Progress request, make sure that you're using the output ID, not the job ID, and make sure your API key is correct. A 404 means that we didn't find an output file with the specified ID for the account linked to the provided API key.

Response Fields.description: State for an output: pending, waiting, processing, finished, failed, or cancelled

title: Get Get_Minutes_Used
name: Get_Get_Minutes_Used
description: In API version 2 /vod and /minutes return the same data. View the /vod documentation for more information on the available options and response fields.

title: Get Usage for Live
name: Get_Usage_for_Live
description: This report returns a breakdown of live-streaming hour usage by day and grouping. It will contain two top-level keys: total and statistics. total will contain the sum of all statistics returned in the report. statistics will contain an entry for each day and grouping. If you don't use the report grouping feature of the API the report will contain only one entry per day. These statistics are collected about once per hour, but there is only one record per day (per grouping). By default this report excludes the current day from the response because it's only partially complete. It's important to note that our service operates in the UTC time zone (including billing periods). All dates and times reported will be in UTC.

URL Params.description: Start date in the format YYYY-MM-DD (default: 30 days ago)
End date in the format YYYY-MM-DD (default: 30 days ago
A grouping name set in the Create a Job operation

Response Fields.description: the grouping - null is for all ungrouped activity

title: Get Usage for VOD
name: Get_Usage_for_VOD
description: This report returns a breakdown of video on demand (videos not using live-streaming) minute usage by day and grouping. It will contain two top-level keys: total and statistics. total will contain the sum of all statistics returned in the report. statistics will contain an entry for each day and grouping. If you don't use the report grouping feature of the API the report will contain only one entry per day. These statistics are collected about once per hour, but there is only one record per day (per grouping). By default this report excludes the current day from the response because it's only partially complete. It's important to note that our service operates in the UTC time zone (including billing periods). All dates and times reported will be in UTC.

URL Params.description: Start date in the format YYYY-MM-DD (default: 30 days ago)
End date in the format YYYY-MM-DD (default: 30 days ago
A grouping name set in the Create a Job operation

Response Fields.description: the grouping - null is for all ungrouped activity
The billable encoding minutes for this group

title: Get Usage for VOD & Live
name: Get_Usage_for_VOD___Live
description: This report returns a breakdown of VOD and live-streaming usage by day and grouping. It will contain two top-level keys: total and statistics. total will contain the sum of all statistics returned in the report. statistics will contain an entry for each day and grouping, broken out by Live and VOD. If you don't use the report grouping feature of the API the report will contain only one entry per day. These statistics are collected about once per hour, but there is only one record per day (per grouping). By default this report excludes the current day from the response because it's only partially complete. It's important to note that our service operates in the UTC time zone (including billing periods). All dates and times reported will be in UTC.

URL Params.description: Start date in the format YYYY-MM-DD (default: 30 days ago)
End date in the format YYYY-MM-DD (default: 30 days ago
A grouping name set in the Create a Job operation
